variants.designation: Fiat G.50 Freccia / G.50bis (variants uncertain - see notes)

metadata.notes: CRITICAL DATA GAP - RESEARCH BRIEF ONLY. ALL NUMERIC FIELDS SET TO PLACEHOLDER VALUES (1 or 0) DUE TO SCHEMA REQUIREMENTS - ACTUAL DATA UNKNOWN. Historical record shows: Unit transferred to Libya January 25, 1941 from Belgium with 31 Fiat G.50 Freccia fighters. Organized in three squadriglie: 351a, 360a, 378a. Reinforced May 27, 1941 with 151a Squadriglia equipped with improved G.50bis variant. Commanded by Maggiore pilota Pietro Bianchi (UNVERIFIED from Tier 1 sources). Operated during Siege of Tobruk conducting fighter sweeps, convoy protection, intercepts, and bomber escort missions (sometimes jointly with Luftwaffe). Suffered from desert sand infiltration until engine filters fitted. Later suffered catastrophic losses November 19, 1941 at Sidi Rezegh (18 aircraft destroyed on ground) and December 22, 1941 at Agedabia (5 aircraft lost). Note: 351a Squadriglia appears with 155° Gruppo Autonomo C.T. in July 1941, suggesting squadriglia reassignment between Q2 and Q3 1941. Available sources lack: specific Q2 aircraft counts, personnel numbers, operational data (sorties/claims/losses for April-June 1941), supply status, verified base location(s), ground support vehicles, ordnance stocks, WITW IDs. Recommend deferring extraction until Christopher Shores Mediterranean Air War series or Italian Air Force official records become available. DO NOT USE THESE PLACEHOLDER VALUES FOR ANALYSIS.

historical_context.formation: Created June 1, 1939 at Ciampino Sud airport, Italy
historical_context.pre_libya_deployment: Deployed to Belgium 1940 for operations against British Isles under command of Major Mario Bonzano
historical_context.transfer_to_libya: January 25, 1941 - arrived with 31 brand new Fiat G.50 Freccia fighters
historical_context.q2_reinforcement: May 27, 1941 - 151a Squadriglia joined with Fiat G.50bis aircraft
historical_context.q2_operations: April-June 1941: Protected troops and supply columns, local intercepts, bomber escort, armed reconnaissance. Operated during Siege of Tobruk.
historical_context.operational_challenges: Desert sand infiltration into engines until filters fitted, typical North Africa supply constraints
historical_context.post_q2_losses: November 19, 1941: 18 G.50s destroyed on ground at Sidi Rezegh by commando raid. December 22, 1941: 5 more aircraft lost at Agedabia.
historical_context.squadriglia_reassignment_note: 351a Squadriglia appears with 155° Gruppo Autonomo C.T. in Derna July 1941, suggesting unit reorganization between Q2 and Q3 1941

data_gaps: Aircraft counts for Q2 1941 (total, operational, damaged, reserve)

Operational data for Q2 1941 (sorties by mission type, aerial claims, aircraft losses, pilot casualties)
Commander verification (Pietro Bianchi needs Tier 1 source confirmation)

Supply status and logistics (fuel reserves days, ammunition reserves days, operational radius km, supply status assessment)
Ground support vehicles (fuel bowsers, bomb dollies, trucks, staff cars, recovery vehicles)
Ordnance stocks (ammunition rounds, cannon shells, fuel liters, bombs by type/weight, drop tanks)
WITW database IDs (unit ID, aircraft IDs)
Operations history with specific dates and quantitative data

Consider: DEFER unit extraction until Tier 1/2 sources become available rather than accepting incomplete data

asisbiz_com.contains: Unit designation, squadriglie composition (351a, 360a, 378a, 151a), aircraft type (G.50/G.50bis), general operational narrative, November 1941 losses
asisbiz_com.missing: Specific Q2 1941 aircraft counts, personnel, sortie data, base locations, supply status
asisbiz_com.assessment: Good for unit identification and context, insufficient for detailed TO&E

web_italian_military_history.contains: Formation date (June 1, 1939), original commander (Major Bonzano), transfer date (January 25, 1941), initial aircraft count (31 G.50s)
web_italian_military_history.missing: Q2 1941 operational details, verified commander for Q2 period, quantitative data
web_italian_military_history.assessment: Useful for timeline context, not sufficient for extraction
